name: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine
Reason: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is 2-nitropyridine, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. (2) The bromine atom adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. (3) The nitro group introduces a strong dipole moment, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. (4) The pyridine ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius.
